com.defano.jmonet.canvas.surface

Interface ScanlineSurface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ScalableSurface
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    PaintCanvas, PaintSurface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPaintCanvas, AbstractPaintSurface, JMonetCanvas

    public interface ScanlineSurface
extends ScalableSurface
    A surface that supports painting "scan lines", that is, a thin line separating rows and columns of pixels that, when visible, produces a matrix effect.

    Scan lines are typically visible only once the scale factor of an image exceeds some threshold (as rendering scanlines with without scaling results in all scan lines and no image pixels).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Color getScanlineColor()
      Gets the color used to paint scanlines.
      AlphaComposite getScanlineComposite()
      Gets the alpha composite mode used when drawing scanlines; impacts how the scanlines affect the underlying graphic and background.
      double getScanlineScaleThreadhold()
      Gets the minimum scale factor that must be met before scanlines are rendered on the image.
      default void paintScanlines(Graphics2D g, Dimension size)
      Paints scanlines on the given graphics context.
      void setScanlineColor(Color scanlineColor)
      Sets the color used to paint scanlines.
      void setScanlineComposite(AlphaComposite scanlineComposite)
      Sets the alpha composite mode used when drawing scanlines; impacts how the scanlines affect the underlying graphic and background.
      void setScanlineScaleThreadhold(double scanlineThreadhold)
      Sets the minimum scale factor that must be met before scanlines are rendered on the image.

        convertModelPointToView, convertViewPointToModel, getScale, getScaleObservable, scaleDimension, scalePoint, scaleRectangle, setScale

    • Method Detail

      • getScanlineScaleThreadhold

        double getScanlineScaleThreadhold()
        Gets the minimum scale factor that must be met before scanlines are rendered on the image.
        Returns:
        The minimum scale factor at which scanlines become visible.

      • setScanlineScaleThreadhold

        void setScanlineScaleThreadhold(double scanlineThreadhold)
        Sets the minimum scale factor that must be met before scanlines are rendered on the image. Set to Integer.MAX_VALUE to prevent scanlines from ever being visible.
        Parameters:
        scanlineThreadhold - The minimum scale factor at which scanlines become visible.

      • getScanlineColor

        Color getScanlineColor()
        Gets the color used to paint scanlines.
        Returns:
        The scanline color

      • setScanlineColor

        void setScanlineColor(Color scanlineColor)
        Sets the color used to paint scanlines.
        Parameters:
        scanlineColor - The scanline color

      • getScanlineComposite

        AlphaComposite getScanlineComposite()
        Gets the alpha composite mode used when drawing scanlines; impacts how the scanlines affect the underlying graphic and background.
        Returns:
        The scanline alpha composite mode.

      • setScanlineComposite

        void setScanlineComposite(AlphaComposite scanlineComposite)
        Sets the alpha composite mode used when drawing scanlines; impacts how the scanlines affect the underlying graphic and background.
        Parameters:
        scanlineComposite - The scanline alpha composite mode.

      • paintScanlines

        default void paintScanlines(Graphics2D g,
                            Dimension size)
        Paints scanlines on the given graphics context.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics context
        size - The size of region onto which scanlines should extend
